result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarrod S Sinnard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarrod S Sinnard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Warrant has been received and destroyed
Warrant was canceled.  Talked to Charlene at GLSO.

10:07 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2014CT97 and to count 1 on 2015CM91; all other counts will be dismissed.  Defendant concurs.  State concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 on 2014CT97 and to count 1 on 2015CM91.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and all other counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CT97

-10 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days.
-$600 fine plus costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-D.L. revocation - 17 months
-IID - 17 months
-AODA

2015CM91

-$100 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court adjourned at 10:16 a.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Jarrod S Sinnard
Current: PO Box 554, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States  (Effective: 09-10-2015)
Prior: 159 Sumner St, Berlin, WI 54923

2:29 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Attorney Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - requests a date for jury trial on 2014CT97.  Court will set all motions and witness lists to be filed by August 28, 2015 and Status Hearing on September 1, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:30 p.m.

2:15 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer on the original case and needs to pretrial both cases.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on July 21, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:16 p.m.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:03 P.M.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing at the same time as the other case is scheduled.

Court adjourned at 1:05 p.m.
